channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024101215
item.description:
Report X-2024101215

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE AT THE DELIVERY DESTINATION CENTER WAS INSPECTED DUE TO SUSPICION OF CONTAINING UNDECLARED CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWENTY USED IPHONES. AT LEAST THREE OF THE IPHONES HAD ENOUGH CHARGE TO POWER ON. THE IPHONES WERE PACKAGED IN BUBBLE WRAP. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED LITHIUM BATTERY DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT. THE SHIPPER CONTACT NAME ON THERMAL LABEL IS JOHN DAZA (311) 242-5997.

item.title: Report I-2024100096
item.description:
Report I-2024100096

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: Buffalo
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Southwest Airlines F951 was in the final boarding process at Gate 18 when a flight attendant notices smoke coming from the overhead bin above rows 14 D,E,F through 16 D,E,F. The carry-on bag vms removed and the on board fire extinguisher was utilized. Passengers were deplaned due to smoke in the cabin and Maintenance conducted ihspection and the aircraft was returned to service. Pictures available upon request of the 2 lithium batteries(Brand- HOHM) that were being transported in the charging cradle(Brand- Unknown) are being held at Southwest Airlines Buffalo Station pending FAA investigation. SWA FAA PHI David Evans has been provide pictures, info and NRC Report.

item.title: Report X-2024101009
item.description:
Report X-2024101009

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: NEW YORK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE AT THE DELIVERY DESTINATION CENTER NEEDED ADDITIONAL TAPING DUE TO THE SEAL OF ONE END OF THE BOX BROKE OPEN. WHILE RETAPING WE DISCOVERED IPHONES WERE INSIDE THE UNMARKED PACKAGE. FULL CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS 17 USED IPHONES. AT LEAST FOUR OF THE IPHONES POWER ON WITH A LOW BATTERY STATUS. THE ADDITIONAL IPHONES DO NOT HAVE ENOUGH CHARGE TO POWER ON. THE CELL PHONES WERE INDIVIDUALLY WRAPPED IN BUBBLE WRAP. THEY WERE THEN PLACED IN GROUPS OF THREE ON BUBBLE WRAP AND FOLDED A FEW TIMES REPEATING UNTIL ALL WERE WRAPPED INTO ONE BUNDLE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT.
